labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [X] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [X] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/81513

### Add your comment and screenshots

#### If possible, a screenshot of a page or application should not be cropped too much. Otherwise, it is not always clear where the element is located

0. **DO NOT** upload screenshots with sexually explicit material on GitHub directly.\
 Instead, upload it to a third-party image hosting and post the link to it without preview (!) here.\
 Also, mention if the link leads to NSFW content;

1. Add screenshots of the problem. You can drag and drop images or paste them from clipboard

    Use `<details> </details>` tag to hide screenshots under the spoiler;

2. Describe the issue in detail until it is absolutely clear from the screenshot what the problem is

    You can also indicate any other information that you think the developers should know.

**Warning:** Please remove personal information before uploading screenshots!

1. Your comment

<!-- Please write a comment here -->

2. Screenshots

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

<details>

<summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>

### Terms

- [X] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body: If any string can resolve this issue as you said in the email conversation with @green1052, you can use `set-cookie`.

Maybe element uses `style="display: block !important;`.

Then test syntax with `?` like:

```adb
outlook.live.com#?##MainModule > div.SW7A6 > div.LBktY > div.q9iRC.css-156:nth-child(3) > div.HOVUa > div.nbmyu.FkPdL.czwRD.LCprM:last-child > div.C1EJK.LyMTI.css-168:first-child > div.full.jYY8g.OKZuz:first-child
```

if filter is generated as unstable then maybe needed test ExtendedCSS power.

comment.body:
Your css selector still match on my PC, did you tried add `?` beetween first and second "hashtag" in my rules editor?

A little shorter will be:

```adb
outlook.live.com#?##MainModule > div > div > div:nth-child(3) > div > div:last-child > div:first-child > div:first-child
!                ^
```

Hello,
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.
In AdGuard's settings please enable `AdGuard Base filter`, update filters (wait about 30-60 seconds until changes will be applied), ensure that content blockers are enabled in system settings and then check again.
If issue will still occurs, then please contact with technical support - https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4(965)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

Vm.Vodafone.net.au

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Voicemail is broken for Vodafone Australia users using native protection 


Creating a profile manually, excluding Vodafone.net.au in the adguard website and using that instead resolves the issue. Could this same exclusion be applied to native protection?



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I believe the issue is that it’s in their dns serves only, and by switching dns it’s no longer resolved, hence the bypass when using a profile works.Switching to any other dns natively causes it to fail.Steve Grigg07 3102 1201tidycal.com/SteveSent from my mobile On 19 Dec 2022, at 11:38 pm, Alex ***@***.***> wrote:﻿
@Steve2Go Hi. It is caused by DNS protection, right?
If so, please test with AdGuard non-filtered DNS in DNS Protection settings.

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.4(965)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

Vm.Vodafone.net.au

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard DNS filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Send Do-Not-Track signals

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Voicemail is broken for Vodafone Australia users using native protection 


Creating a profile manually, excluding Vodafone.net.au in the adguard website and using that instead resolves the issue. Could this same exclusion be applied to native protection?



### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
@Steve2Go Hi. It is caused by DNS protection, right?
If so, please test with AdGuard non-filtered DNS in _**DNS Protection**_ settings.

comment.body:
This issue has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/395

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

comment.body:
Culprit is the $important part in display again (like for sport.de one).

Please check these two rules:
```
krautundrueben.de#$?#.billboard { display: none !important; }
krautundrueben.de##.rectangle
```
